ygData.subject: Re: [OT] Brewing, Pottery and the Norrath economy
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh... thanks for the suggestions but here is what I have already experienced with the following in the past.... ... worth fighting at my level impossible to
ygData.messageBody:
Heh... thanks for the suggestions but here is what I have already
experienced with the following in the past....

>Elite orcs in crushbone - CB is heavily camped at all times making anything
worth fighting at my level impossible to get to, or fairly deadly since they
bash and stun fairly frequently.

>Elite gnolls in blackburrow - These are indeed blue to experience giving
greens, but again, heavily camped... last night I got chastised for killing
one that was just standing around while the party that chastized me killed
something else two rooms away.

>Nobles in paw (exceptional loot) - Last time I was there this area was
badly camped as well but I havent been back for quite a while. Worth
checking out again, thanks. :)

>Mammoth calves in everfrost - Tried this. The calf brought me to 2 bubbles
of health before I killed it and I got no noticable experience from it.

>Elephant calves in south karana - Haven't tried this but I suspect it would
be the same story as the Mammoths.

>Lion patriarchs/matriarchs in east karana - All the ones I have seen have
been green to me....

>Beatles (borer?) in north karana - I tend not to spend much time in North
Karana as those damnable griffons scare the socks off me. :)

>Alligators in oasis - Not too tough, but even less xp gain than the
mammoths as far as I could tell, and again the area seems to be almost
constantly camped.

I do thank you for the suggestions though... I may well try those beetles
and I have been thinking of going back to Paw so you confirmed what I
believed was true in that. Thank you for the help :)

Liani, SongWeaver of the 16th Measure, Guardian of Faydwer, Betrothed of
Theodoric.... from the reality of Bristlebane
